intro: Sempervivum heterotrichum, commonly known as the stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern and fleshy, thick leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white during the summer months. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions has earned it the common name "everlasting," reflecting its resilience and long lifespan.
